pages.text: Archaeopteryx more famously is known for its contributions to evolutionary sciences. It is often cited as a transitional fossil between non-avian dinosaurs and modern day birds, making it invaluable to science. Archaeopteryx fittingly in German is sometimes referred to as "Urvogel" or "primaeval bird".

Like many others like it, whether Archaeopteryx could fly is a controversial subject. Most recently, Voeten, Dennis F.A.E.; et al. (2018) determined that Archaeopteryx could've had a flight stroke style similar to the grabbing motion of other maniraptorans. It was hypothesized to fly like pheasants, quickly escaping predators and flying for a brief time.
